manifiesto.title_2: We urge a more compassionate way of relating to our environment.
manifiesto.subtitle: A listener is not an object for listening, it is an attitude; we are listeners if we choose to be, and here are its principles:

principles.title: Mindfulness
principles.text: Being willing to live in the present, listening to the details of life inhabiting your surroundings without judgment.

principles.title: Infinite Curiosity
principles.text: We must cultivate curiosity for all those subtle movements that occur before our ears.

principles.title: Admire Complexity
principles.text: Every sound and vibration in a natural environment is never random; it is always linked to a natural phenomenon.

principles.title: Deep Respect
principles.text: Our presence disturbs. Respect is only the first step to activate listening as a form of protection.

principles.title: Provocative Imagination
principles.text: Imagine what the sounds you hear look like, moving beyond your first mental image.

principles.title: Becoming One with the Landscape
principles.text: Once aware of the soundscape surrounding you, try to move at its rhythm and orchestrate with everything that sounds.

servicios.hero_subtitle: Do you know a soundscape that shouldn't disappear and that you want to protect...
servicios.hero_question: Do you want to install a listener or know a place where it would be important to install one?
servicios.pillar1_desc: We know that one way to protect something is by knowing it, which is why we support organizations interested in care and regeneration...
servicios.pillar2_desc: We believe science and technology should be at the service of protecting life and never the other way around.
servicios.pillar3_desc: No protection is possible without involving the entire community upon which a natural area depends.

items.title: Sound Artifact Creation
items.text: From blueprints to implementation, we accompany the process from start to finish.

items.title: Sound Route Design
items.text: We create visitable routes to appreciate the soundscape of a natural area.

items.title: Analysis and Monitoring
items.text: We generate valuable information from species identification to acoustic indices.

hero.title: LISTENING TO PROTECT OURSELVES
hero.description: Just as there are viewpoints, there must be listeners; the first one is in the process of disintegration in the Tingo María National Park.

content.description_1: Changes in the soundscape can indicate alterations in the environment, such as biodiversity loss or environmental threats. With technology, we can record and analyze these frequencies to monitor ecosystem health.
content.description_2: Our latest built listening artifact consists of three 'ears' of different sizes that allow us to listen to different types of natural sound ranges.

large.title: The largest ear
large.desc: was designed to listen to major geophysical sounds, such as rivers, waterfalls, winds, moving trees, as well as mammals with long-range vocalization.

medium.title: The medium ear
medium.desc: useful for contemplating the vocalization of mammals, birds, short-range sounds like human voices, and everything within 2 to 3 km.

small.title: The small ear
small.desc: serves to contemplate smaller and more granular sounds such as insects, whispers caused by the wind, and everything around the listening point.

quote.line1: IF THERE IS LIFE, THERE ARE SOUNDS.
quote.sub: To take care of ourselves, we first have to listen to each other; there is no empathy possible without honest listening.

physical.title: PHYSICAL AND REAL
physical.desc: Everything that has life vibrates. The listener is made of organic materials like wood, mats, and steel that the jungle is slowly reclaiming.

meditative.title: MEDITATIVE SPACE
meditative.desc: The space presents itself as a sound bath to recalibrate our sound perception. We suggest taking 5 deep breaths.

fragility.title: SOUND FRAGILITY
fragility.desc: We urge a more compassionate way of relating to our environment. Being a listener means having compassion and finding beauty in the soundscape.
